a1: URL encoding converts special characters (spaces, symbols, non-ASCII) into percent-encoded format (e.g., space becomes %20) so they can be safely used in URLs.
q2: When should I use URL encoding?
a2: Use it when passing special characters in URL query parameters, form data, or API requests. It ensures the URL is valid and characters are interpreted correctly.
a3: Yes. The encoder uses encodeURIComponent which properly handles all Unicode characters including emoji, accented letters, and CJK characters.
